TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit InvalidEnumArgumentException extends System.ArgumentException

Docs.summary: The exception thrown when using invalid arguments that are enumerators.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This exception is thrown if you pass an invalid enumeration value to a method or when setting a property.
## Examples The following code example shows how to catch an <xref:System.ComponentModel.InvalidEnumArgumentException> exception and interpret its content. The example attempts to pass an invalid enumeration value (`MessageBoxButtons`) through casting, as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method's third argument. Upon catching the exception, the example fetches the respective error message, the invalid parameter, stack trace, and origin of the exception.
[!code-cpp[enumException#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/enumException/CPP/enumexception.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[enumException#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/enumException/CS/enumexception.cs#1)] [!code-vb[enumException#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/enumException/VB/enumexception.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public InvalidEnumArgumentException (string argumentName, int invalidValue, Type enumClass);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string argumentName, int32 invalidValue, class System.Type enumClass) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the argument that caused the exception.
The value of the argument that failed.
A that represents the enumeration class with the valid values.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a message generated from the argument, the invalid value, and an enumeration class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This constructor will create a localized message saying that the `argumentName` parameter was invalid because the value passed in was invalid, and that the value should be one of the values in the enumeration class.
